website_summaries.verdict: The Intel Next Unit of Computing (NUC) is a neat little DIY kit that delivers Core i3 processing power in a form factor that fits in the palm of your hand. But it gets pricey once you add in all the necessary extras.
cons: Price does not include storage or RAM

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these to run openelc (XBMC embedded). Works perfectly. Added 2GB ram and outputs full HD flawlessly. Use it to stream live iptv via my vusolo box. No complaints. Quiet and discreet. Hidden behind the TV out of sight. Only con is no IR on the box, so had to add FLIRC (from Amazon) to use a remote control with it. Very pleased with the purchase. Slightly expensive after you add memory and mSATA drive. This should be priced <$150 then it's good value. Thinking of getting another as a router (1 port router with VLAN tagging from a managed switch).
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: A great little computer Mountain Lion and Yosemite work great
customer_reviews.text: A great little computer Mountain Lion and Yosemite work great . I took away one star since I had to return one because I thought it was bad. Turned out when the linux OS went to sleep. It wouldn't wake up, Tried unplugging the unit, clearing the CMOS jumper and it still wouldn't POST. Once my replacement unit arrived and did the same thing I knew something was up. The only way I could get it to power back on was to take the unit apart and remove the CMOS battery for a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: ViennaDisco

customer_reviews.title: Great Server.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a Ubuntu home server for doing some development for a website idea I am playing around with. I did have some problems choosing a distro because some seemed to struggle with the install, but once everything has gotten up and running, it has stayed on for the past 2 months with no downtime. Would definitely recommend this for an inexpensive little linux box. Just be aware that this is not a complete system, and you will need to get compatible memory and storage.
customer_reviews.author: DJMoody

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Using for Openelec. Had it up and running with Kodi in less that 30 minutes. UPDATE Sep 13, 2016: Unit is still going strong. Starts to TVMC (Kodi) in 7 seconds and runs quiet. Bought an IR remote with a small keyboard for $18. Couldn't be happier with this for what I'm using it for.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great case, misleading description.
customer_reviews.text: Building a small htpc and this case looked perfect. My only complain is the fact that they dont openly tell you that you'll need a extra laptop cable in order to hook into the brick they supply and that "Wifi/Bluetooth Antennae integrated into the chassis for ease of integration" made me assume wifi and bluetooth were already onboard. They weren't and now I'm waiting for the delivery of that card. Super quite, stays cool, and powerful with 8gigs of ram and a 120gb SSD - more than sufficient to run xbmc.
customer_reviews.author: Josey Morton

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Ubuntu.
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. Ubuntu works perfectly on it. You do need to buy an mSATA hard drive, wifi adapter, DDR3 memory, and a power cord separately.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love these little engines that could!
customer_reviews.text: Tell people this is a computer and not artwork. You'll be lying to them but their reaction is worth it. It's both. Artwork and functional as a PC. Quiet and reliable. Excellent performance. Waiting patiently for the i7 version to help me spend some of my R&D budget.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Alcorn

customer_reviews.title: the product just came with the nuc kit not what ...
customer_reviews.text: the product just came with the nuc kit not what the ítems advertirse. Intel Desktop/HTPC (Intel Dual Core i3, 8GB DDR3, 500GB SSD, WIFI and Bluetooth, Windows 10 Pro) is an emty case with the main board, is missing the HDD, memory, Windows 10[[ASIN:B0093LINVK Intel Desktop/HTPC (Intel Dual Core i3, 8GB DDR3, 500GB SSD, WIFI and Bluetooth, Windows 10 Pro)
customer_reviews.author: sammy smulevich

customer_reviews.title: Ultra low watts
customer_reviews.text: 22 watts under heavy CPU load via prime95 and 9.8 watts on idle. SSD AC WIFI 8gigs setup. Running windows 8 pro perfect on a 1080p 52 inch lcd screen. Perfect for HTPC or as a home security DVR something that is is on 24/7. Runs great and want to buy another for my work at home PC, that thing does 85 watts idle and since I work at home it adds up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Perez

customer_reviews.title: Good for a media server
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a server for Plex, and as a general-purpose NAS. It's easily able to transcode 1080P video for my Chromecast in real-time. I dropped a star for not having USB 3.0 support.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The NUC is great but I love the box it came in better
customer_reviews.text: The box it came in was completely better than the actual computer itself. You open it and it makes the Intel chime from the commercials. I actually hid it in my drop ceiling so at work when someone turns on the light in the room the sound plays :) Worth Every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Huntsbarger

customer_reviews.title: Good conference room PC
customer_reviews.text: Using this one as a conference room PC for the occasional webinar, training, etc... No issues at all so far running Windows 7 Pro x64.
customer_reviews.author: Doof

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for use as a Zentyal Ubuntu 14 server. Zero noise. Fast load. Configured with 128GB SSD, 8GB RAM, wireless keyboard and mouse, additional external USB Ethernet NIC for multi-homing.
customer_reviews.author: AARON P.

customer_reviews.title: good, basic workstation for many clients
customer_reviews.text: I build systems for many clients with offices from 5-20 stations. They need Windows, Office, Internet, and a couple of company applications. These Intel NUC units really fit the bill, to replace their 5-8 year old pc's.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rambow

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly powerful for its size
customer_reviews.text: I went with 16 gigs of ram and 128 gig solid state drives, and these little buggers fly. I'd give it 5 stars, but it runs quite hot despite having quite an annoying fan.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thomason

customer_reviews.title: Silent - Great HTPC
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a netboot MythTV frontend. I just put RAM in it, no SSD, and netboot (like all my other MythTV machines). It's basically silent and plenty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great little computer.
customer_reviews.text: Great little computer. Definitely worth springing the extra money for the i5 from the i3 model. Tried both. i3 is a dog.
customer_reviews.author: gckat

customer_reviews.title: Truly it is a next generation of HTPC
customer_reviews.text: A perfect little HTPC. I'd say - a next generation of it. It has enough juice to run everything , including 3D Blurays. It has major advantages over previous Intel Atom based HTPCs - it has a superior graphics, much lower energy footprint, very serious CPU compare to under powered Atoms. can run 1080p clips even without hardware assisted acceleration and (very important to me) - USB wakeup - you can wake it up from sleep by pressing a key on your USB based remote keyboard/mouse ( Atom based mini-PCs did not have that ability)
customer_reviews.author: computer professional

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my adult son for Christmas and he danced around like he was 8 years old and giddy! He said this is the greatest thing for computer geeks!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy  Metz

customer_reviews.title: A Great All Around Computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two months ago and it has been working without problems since then. I use it primarily as a home theater PC (HTPC), and have not encountered any issues watching DVDs or viewing other media from the web or the external USB drive. Attach a webcam to your HTPC setup, and you've got yourself instant videoconferencing. It also works great as a replacement for a desktop. Installing the latest version of Linux Mint was a snap! When it comes time to replace my current desktop, I'll definitely be back to see what's the latest with the Intel NUC.
customer_reviews.author: GBE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for running mach3 also have one recording tv...love these
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Baby Beast
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this little computer! It is mighty on speed and power and still fits in the palm of my hand! I use it as my entertainment center and it kicks @ss! HDMI throughput is flawless, boot time is 8 seconds, even games without huge hardware needs run smoothly on it! It does get warm when you run it, but it only gets so warm and no warmer, which is pretty good for a tiny computer. I definitely recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: inSohmniac

customer_reviews.title: NUC Overheats
customer_reviews.text: I spent 40. + shipping in addition to the full price of this unit in order to have it diagnosed/repaired before Intel came out with their free heat guard. The heat guard also was not effective. Then I had to send the unit back to Intel to have it replaced. This whole process took many months of troubleshooting, denials, and getting lost in rat holes while the real issue was determined. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: briente

customer_reviews.title: Great little HTPC
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the numerous components in my AV cabinet, while giving me the multitude of streaming options that a proprietary media box would/could not. I have the machine loaded with Windows 8 and am running XBMC, iTunes, Amazon Unbox and Netflix with no issue. For optical media, i use a USB3 bluray drive. Though no powerhouse, it is quite capable of playing games at a moderate setting. The NUC requires the additional purchases of the SSD RAM and power cord. I would also recommend the purchase of a WiFi/Bluetooth radio. Component installation was quick, less than five minutes: the most difficult part attaching the internal antennae to the radio.
customer_reviews.author: S. Arden

customer_reviews.title: So awesome
customer_reviews.text: The NUC is incredibly small and its specs line up with a lot of way way larger desktop towers I was looking at. Cant recommend this enough!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Vengrin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I got this with Intel centrino 6235, 8GB DDR3 & 128GB mSATA. Installed Win 7 64-bit (make sure you download the drivers from the website) with XBMC. Bad boy boots in less than 20 seconds (right into XBMC). I am extremely impressed with its performance. I know it not a fair comparison but it run all over my boxee box.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Computer
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is compact and very fast. I would recommend it to anyone thinking about upgrading from there older XP machine.
customer_reviews.author: Lee P.

customer_reviews.title: end of the tower
customer_reviews.text: this sweet little computer does it all! I use it to manage an extensive I-tunes library and interface with high end audio equipment. I do all of my office related work on it and it works great. No issues! I liked it so much I bought one for my home.
customer_reviews.author: cave painter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small little product
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe how well built this product is. It boots windows 8 in 7 seconds from the time you pres the power button. I'm using this as my media center. My build is with the following items Cable  Bluetooth Keyboard:  Logitech Keyboard: You can use this to save some.  256gb mSata  8gb RAM  Bluetooth and Wifi  PS3 Blumote
customer_reviews.author: ASadani

customer_reviews.title: Small and quiet unit for studio work
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small, quiet machine for a studio DAW. The NUC does what I need, though I wish it had USB3.0 and an eSATA port.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Scott Rider

customer_reviews.title: Small, Quiet, Fast
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting much from an i3 processor, but I was surprised by how well this little box performs. I used 8GB of ram and 256GB mSSD. Using Windows 7, I can boot in about 15 seconds. The windows experience score is 5.4, the on board video is what is bringing it down(otherwise everything else was 6.4 or above). I used it with a 40" Samsung LCD and it worked great. I did hardwired it to my network, so I cannot speak about wireless and heat. For a fast little home theater streaming box, it really fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Intel NUC
customer_reviews.text: These Intel NUC are the next best thing if you want a full size desktop for fraction of the size. We use these at our company to mount behind monitors and TVs. Easy to build and come in a cool Intel packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: SSD loses connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Installed 128Gig SSD. Will be fine one day, next day the drive is not detected. I have to physically remove and then re-install the drive. The unit then boots from the drive for a day until it disappears and I have to remove/re-install again. Moved on to an flash-drive with Ubuntu to avoid the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mikelson

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly fast and stable
customer_reviews.text: Using this as POS terminal at our small business. It's so much faster that our old desktops with traditional hard drives. I think having to buy the components separate is a great idea as it helps keep costs down plus there is no bloat ware hampering the setup. It was super easy to assemble and I was up and running in no time. If you don't have an external dvd/cd rom you will need to create a bootable USB drive. (google it)
customer_reviews.author: E Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great PC's...but odd issue
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered these a few times. However the past 3 times from Amazon I get the unit with the power brick but no cord to plug into the wall...Not sure why that is. Oddly enough the product's page is linked to the correct power cord. But I can't imagine Intel would sell these without the power cord. A bit bizarre.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fantini

customer_reviews.title: Great box but missing power cord
customer_reviews.text: It's small, it's well built, and is tailor made for tradeshows and it even comes with an amazing VESA adapter plate that's actually made of metal. However....I ordered the thunderbolt edition and the dual HDMI came instead....and NO power cord to go from the power brick to the wall....and the box was still shrink wrapped and the cheesy intel sound effect was still playing when I opened the box.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Chee

customer_reviews.title: Works as described but there is one issue...heat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an internal wireless card for this PC but I ended up not installing it based on other reviews. This was not a show stopper but it almost made me rate it 3 stars. That is something they should have considered in initial testing. However, this is a great little PC. Works well with wired network connection. Drives two monitors extremely well (IMO). i really like the ease of use with two monitors. I use both HDMI ports
customer_reviews.author: jschaube

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I installed the Linux Mint system and it turns up in less than 10 seconds. I use it as a hotspot to be a network gateway and a multimedia server. It works very well. No complains so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rogerio M.

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but needs work
customer_reviews.text: this is a very peppy unit but i would have loved to see USB3 and thunderbolt (yes i know there is one with thunderbolt but its at the expense of that gigabit port) but in my tests it show this little box is great and hope to a improved version soon
customer_reviews.author: Jsalz1

customer_reviews.title: So small!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly small! Wish it had USB 3.0 though : ( Very fast! Extremely well built! Don't forget to get a local clover cable as it isn't included!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini Device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the 16GB corsair RAM, 64GB Crucial M4 SSD and it hasn't disappointed. It is my demo machine for my travels all across the world. And it fits in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B Kessler

customer_reviews.title: A desktop computer in a tiny package
customer_reviews.text: Add a mSATA SSD, RAM, Windows 7 and, optionally, a wireless card and you have all you need for most office work. The Core i3 processor is the equivalent of what is found in a basic notebook computer. I assembled mine with a 256GB SSD and 16 GB of RAM. I also installed the Intel WiFi/Bluetooth combo wireless card. That's more than enough computer for most applications. Models with i5 and i7 CPU's will be coming from Intel later in 2013.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product - very speedu
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Impressive amount of power in such a compact design. I can see a plethora of uses for this, and it's definitely handy to have such a small PC around. Honestly, I'm still surprised at how speedy it is with Ubuntu.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert M

product_meta.title: Intel Desktop/HTPC (Intel Dual Core i3, 8GB DDR3, 500GB SSD, WIFI and Bluetooth, Windows 10 Pro)
product_meta.description: THINK YOU KNOW WHAT SMALL CAN DO? THINK AGAIN. No more compromising between performance, profile, and price. The Next Unit of Computing (NUC) is a tiny 4"×4"×2" computing device with the power of the 3rd generation Intel Core i3 processor. Its lower power consumption enables innovative system designs and energy-efficient applications in places like digital signage, home entertainment, and portable uses. SUPERIOR PROCESSING AND GRAPHICS - Visibly smart graphics using the 3rd generation Intel Core i3-3217U processor deliver amazing performance and visually stunning graphics. STUNNINGLY SMALL FORM FACTOR - The 4"×4"×2" form factor unlocks a world of potential design applications, from digital signage and kiosks to portable innovations. ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY - The NUC features two SO-DIMM sockets for expandability upto 16 GB of memory, two PCIe mini-card connectors for flexible support of wireless and SSD configurations, BIOS vault technology, fast boot and the Intel Visual BIOS. The NUC also supports The Intel Anti-Theft Technology providing hardware intelligence designed to protect your device and its data if its lost or stolen.
feature_bullets: Ultra Small Form Factor (USFF) Computing Platform at approximately 4" x 4"
Supports Display Independent Display capability using HDMI 1.4a
Supports up to 16GB of SO-DIMM Memory
Wifi/Bluetooth Antennae integrated into the chassis for ease of integration
